turn.text: And if we can read this statute that way in spite of what the District Judge said.

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: That's the way I read it.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: What you are saying is in spite in view of the light, in view of the light (Inaudible)?
And what you're saying is that we have to consider this as a simple unqualified statute to make into a sentence to tell obscene literature seriously.
And further that there is to be incorporated the rules that in determining our representative, the publication in its entire as a whole, you can't tear out a page or two (Inaudible).

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: That's right.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Is that your -- that that's what --

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: I -- I agree with Judge Hand on that.
I do.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: Well --

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: (Inaudible)

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: I understood.
That's -- that is under a different statute.
All I'm saying is that -- you're saying that exactly to me although the Michigan Supreme Court hasn't got much of the authoritative light, is that right?

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: Certainly.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: But why -- why do you have to reach that at all?
Did this -- did this judge decide on the book as a whole?

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: I think so, as I read this entire record.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: If -- if he did decide on it as a whole, you don't have to take up the problem of --

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: You don't take the marginal cases.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: The marginal cases.

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: Marginal cases or maybe the case later on or --

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: Maybe that one obscene word in the book but not ban the whole book --

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: No.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: -- under the statute.

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: That's right.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: We don't have -- we don't reach that?

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: That's right.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Suppose the incidence, it covers 40 pages in the 500-page book.

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: Pardon Your Honor?

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Suppose the incidence then instead to cover 40 pages on a 500-page book and your Recorder decides that the book as a whole is immoral, obscene, and so forth.
What about that?
Does that settle it?

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: I think that settles the issue of faith, of course they didn't go -- they can go to a jury.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Suppose the incidence is only five pages and he decides that it's -- that as a whole.

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: Well, this is more than five pages.
You're reaching a marginal case.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: I don't know.
I don't know --

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: We might run into trouble with the case of that kind but --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: What about Shakespeare's Venus and Adonis?
Where does it stand -- where does it stand --

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: Well --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Where does it stand in this?

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: With the Rape of Lucrece, I think if you put the Rape of Lucrece in a paper covered book and sold it through drugstore outlets, it might be considered salacious or obscene, maybe.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: And the man who had it -- any man, any bookseller who had in its -- in his possession would be guilty on the old statute of violating that law.

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: If it were sold through those channels or to children as notoriously congregate.

turn.speaker: felix_frankfurter
turn.label: Justice Felix Frankfurter
turn.text: You have to add one more relevance, Mr. Shepherd, and the jury must still find it.

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: That's right.
The conscience of the community speaking through its -- through the jury.
Thank you for your attention.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Would it -- would it be proper to say that I think it has been said in some of the cases that one must find that the dominant purpose of the writer was obscenity?

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: I think that's the -- that's the basis of the whole book rule, is it not dominant?

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: But the whole book might be obscene but it might be a work in literature such as innocent adolescence.
Certainly, it wasn't in a five-cent copy or a 10-cent copy would be probably wholly obscene.

turn.speaker: edmund_e_shepherd
turn.label: Mr. Edmund E. Shepherd
turn.text: It may.
It's quite a problem.
We submit this --

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Mr. Robbins, do you have anything more?
Very well.
